text: <@U11MANG9G> was around a bit back… he might have some thoughts ^^^
"Must every trucker run their own peer, or can a single peer handle many truckers ﻿⁠⁠as if﻿⁠⁠ they were independent peers?"
It really depends on how you choose to implement this. To simplify, each “party” or “counterparty” has an EnrollmentID

"Or is it all mixed in under the supplier’s credentials?”
Nope, it’s not mixed.

"Can a Fabric Peer host many Personas?”
Hopefully I’m not oversimplifying it - but you can have multiple EnrollmentIDs (e.g. by registering with different IDs).
I, Jonathan, for example have more than one email, but I’m the same guy. I can email you (Pinku) from both accounts and you may or may not know that these accounts are linked.
<@U11MANG9G>, <@U0ULK2JPP>: I’ll dig around in the documentation to learn how to implement something like that. Thanks for the help!
<@U149660UA>: with pleasure. Hope this helped. Let us know.

When confidentiality is turned on, the payload of every block is encrypted, because some transactions are not suitable for everyone to access.
How can I decrypt this payload in the block? Which API can i invoke?
